availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Owsley County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Malinda Maloney. Father of William Maloney, Eleanor Maloney, Susan Maloney, Elizabeth Maloney, George Maloney, Nancy Maloney, and Donelson Maloney. Served in the 1st Kentucky Regiment Capital Guards. Farmer in Owsley County in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breathitt County, District 2, p. 1. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley County, Spruce Grove, p. 130. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lee County, Thomas Precinct, p. 11. Organization Index to Pension Files of Veterans who served between 1861 and 1900, Ancestry, Civil War Pensions Index, roll no. 170.
